channel.title: Thought about this
channel.description:
So just out of wondering, why is this such a big deal? Do you guys think this is a big deal? To me I honestly don't I mean its just a sign.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/45jsng1.png[/img]

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

The “native” tongue for actual Americans (not European immigrants/invaders) would be the Native American dialects (navajo, aztec, etc).

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I think trolling. Otherwise, just ignorance.

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

It’s called racism.

Pronouncing a word different due to an accent is a different story.

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:


The only place where people flip out over the order a sign is in

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @Chronikk_HD Chronikk_HD
item.description:
@Chronikk_HD wrote:

sk8rdude461:

To be honest. I’ve always supported our nation being a English-only nation. What I mean is that it wouldn’t be required that instructions be printed in 5 languages, or that we don’t need to make caution/warning signs in Spanish, or any other language. You obviously live in or came to America for some reason, you might as well learn the ‘native’ tongue. Would you go to Russia and expect them to speak English? Or Germany? No, they’ll speak Russian or German as their native language, but chances are they do know English because America has pushed it’s values into any country’s asshole that it could.

Man, if I could give you a high five or that shit right now I would . I’ve been called racist one time cause I spoke an opinion similar to this and it’s just BS. we live in America… we speak English… while yes I think it’s cool to have a melting-pot, culture diverse country, we speak English…

side note. that bitch in the Facebook status is too extreme…

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Krackkid, post:6, topic:536797”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=655614.msg4388924#msg4388924 date=1386733228]

But the difference there is a lot of countries that are more willing to learn English for tourist, so why is it so hard for us to accept other languages?

I don’t think you read what I posted clearly:

No, they’ll speak Russian or German as their native language, but chances are they do know English because America has pushed it’s values into any country’s asshole that it could.

[/quote]
Oops I did skim over that without realizing, but that’s my point its really not that big of a deal. Whats the big deal with a sign having different translations of the same word?

Yeah I do think that English should be an official language, but it isn’t so this shouldn’t matter. Not to mention its just a sign, why must people get so mad about it.[/quote]
That’s what I said. I’m not super super about it, but I don’t think we should need to bend to their will (not saying any race in specifics, but especially to illegals).

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

In that case your friend is overreacting and over thinking something as trivial as what order a paper says happy holidays.

Read full topic

item.title: Thought about this
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:7, topic:536797”]Is your area predominantly Spanish-speaking?
Also, your friend seems very ill-tempered.[/quote]No that is Petsmart everywhere do this, and not my friend saw her post through petsmart. But as for the store I work at, no I don’t think I have ever seen a spanish speaking person come into the store.

Read full topic

But the difference there is a lot of countries that are more willing to learn English for tourist, so why is it so hard for us to accept other languages?
[/quote]
I don’t think you read what I posted clearly:

No, they’ll speak Russian or German as their native language, but chances are they do know English because America has pushed it’s values into any country’s asshole that it could.[/quote]

Oops I did skim over that without realizing, but that’s my point its really not that big of a deal. Whats the big deal with a sign having different translations of the same word?

Yeah I do think that English should be an official language, but it isn’t so this shouldn’t matter. Not to mention its just a sign, why must people get so mad about it.

Read full topic
